name: Muslim American Youth Foundation
mission: TO CREATE AND OPERATE A FACILITY FOR YOUTH EDUCATION, ENRICHMENT, AND ENLIGHTENMENT.
theoryOfChange: Educate, Enrich, and Enlighten: providing culturally relevant and spiritually grounded programs (inputs) to strengthen identity and values (outputs) to enable youth to lead and uplift communities (outcomes).

score_details.score_summary: Muslim American Youth Foundation earns 46/100 due to good alignment and limited impact (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The search results for "Muslim American Youth Foundation" (MAYF) do not explicitly mention that the organization accepts zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or zakat campaigns. The organization's mission focuses on empowering and uplifting Muslim-American youth through educational, spiritual, and community programs.

all_citations.claim: The organization focuses on youth education and enrichment and has a medium donor alignment score.
The foundation reported total revenue of $1,734,105 and a program expense ratio of 72.1%.
Programs include community services, youth sports, athletics, and mentoring.
The organization provides options for general charitable giving and sadaqah.
Community engagement is facilitated through volunteer opportunities and youth programs.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 30/50, the charity offers a medium fit for donors interested in religious and cultural youth development [1]. The organization accepts sadaqah-eligible contributions to fund its various educational and athletic programs [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation allocates a program expense ratio of 72.1% toward its core initiatives, including youth sports and community services [2]. While the organization maintains a healthy 13.4 months of working capital, the impact score of 17/50 reflects a capacity-building model where specific long-term outcomes are not yet independently verified [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim American Youth Foundation provides a dedicated space for youth education, enrichment, and athletic mentoring to foster community development.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.03 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity position with 13.4 months of working capital
Direct focus on youth athletics and mentoring programs
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) operates as a non-profit organization dedicated to creating facilities for youth enlightenment and community services [1][2]. In the most recent fiscal period, the organization reported a total revenue of $1,734,105 to support its mission of education and enrichment [2].

strengths.detail: The foundation demonstrates highly disciplined spending on donor acquisition, requiring only <cite id="1">$0.03 in expenses for every $1 raised</cite>.
The organization maintains <cite id="1">13.4 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer for its facility-based operations.
The foundation has achieved a <cite id="2">73.3% three-year revenue CAGR</cite>, growing from approximately $577,000 in 2021 to <cite id="2">over $1.7 million in 2023</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: The Muslim American Youth Foundation's primary strength lies in its ability to scale resources rapidly while maintaining <cite id="1">100% independent board governance</cite>. This growth is supported by a diversified revenue stream that includes <cite id="2">$225,128 in program service revenue</cite> alongside traditional contributions. Their facility-centric model is well-funded, as evidenced by <cite id="2">total assets of $5,337,942</cite>, which allows them to provide consistent <cite id="5">mentoring and athletic programs</cite> without the immediate pressure of month-to-month fundraising fluctuations.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) is a community-focused organization dedicated to <cite id="1">creating and operating facilities for youth education</cite>, enrichment, and enlightenment. Based in the United States, the foundation serves as a hub for <cite id="1">community services, youth sports, and athletics mentoring</cite>, aiming to foster a supportive environment for the next generation. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $1,734,105</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="2">three-year revenue growth rate of 73.3%</cite>. While the foundation is relatively young, having been <cite id="1">founded in 2016</cite>, it has rapidly scaled its financial footprint to support a diverse array of programs including <cite id="5">faith-based initiatives and health advocacy</cite>. The organization operates with high fundraising efficiency, spending only <cite id="1">$0.03 to raise every $1</cite> in charitable contributions. However, its financial model currently allocates a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 72.1%</cite>, which is lower than the <cite id="2">peer program ratio median of 81.7%</cite> for similar religious and cultural organizations. Despite this, MAYF maintains a robust financial cushion with <cite id="1">13.4 months of working capital</cite> held in working capital, ensuring long-term stability for its physical facilities and ongoing mentoring programs.
